question: Calculate the standard deviation (SD) of the following set of marks on a statistics test: 30, 60, 50, 40, 70
Sony is testing a new laser to measure distances between driving cars. Sony tested the same distance four times and got the data points 3, 5, 6 and 10 feet (with one laser). What is the SD?
The lasers’ measure does not have to be accurate. In fact, they are willing to accept mistakes of 1 foot or less. If mistakes of 1 foot or less are okay, what is the updated SD of the laser?
